text: Josuee Jesús Herrera Taber (born 2 February 1999) is a Peruvian footballer who plays as a winger for Peruvian Primera División side Sport Boys. ==Club career== ===Sport Boys=== 18-year old Herrera moved to Sport Boys from Universidad San Martín in 2018 and scored in his first game for the club's reserve team in February 2018, one day after his 19th birthday, against the reserve team of Real Garcilaso.Dejó la San Martín y mostró su hambre de gol en el debut con la Reserva del Sport Boys, toqueygol.com, 17 February 2018Copa de Oro (99): Josuee Herrera, futbolista de San Martín (VIDEO), peru.com, 23 July 2015 Herrera got his professional debut for Sport Boys on 20 August 2018 against Sport Rosario. Herrera was in the line up, but was replaced in the half time.SPORT ROSARIO VS. SPORT BOYS 1 - 1, soccerway.com, 20 August 2019 He made a total of six appearances in the Peruvian Primera División and scored one goal in the 2018 season. He was promoted permanently in to the first team squad ahead of the 2019 season.Josué Herrera: “Somos un grupo bien unido, y esto lo demostramos en cada partido”, lacantera11.home.blog, 7 July 2019 In December 2019, Herrera revealed that they had been interest from FBC Melgar, but he wanted to stay at Sport Boys at least until his contract expired in 2021.Portal Rosado - Josue Herrera: "Tengo contrato con Sport... | Facebook, facebook.com, 1 December 2019 Herrera ended the 2019 season with 16 games and one goal in the Peruvian Primera División. In the beginning of the 2020 season, he got injured.(FOTO) Conoce la lista de lesionados del Sport Boys, ovacion.pe, 12 February 2020 ==References== ==External links== * Category:Living people Category:1999 births Category:Association football wingers Category:Peruvian footballers Category:Peruvian Primera División players Category:Universidad San Martín footballers Category:Sport Boys footballers Category:People from Ica, Peru
title: Josuee Herrera
